quest.name: Out of the Shadows
journal: The secretariat's resigned expression speaks volumes.

You arrive at Maelstrom Command only to be greeted by a linkpearl call from Wheiskaet. The Company's first mate would have you join him in Costa del Sol to discuss a possible new development in your mission to take down the blasphemy. The secretariat states that she will inform the Admiral of your absence, and so you depart for eastern La Noscea.

At Costa del Sol, Wheiskaet explains that while he and his companions are at a loss as to how to effectively counter the blasphemy's devastating attack, he knows of someone who might fare better: a former member of the Company known for his keen eye in assessing the enemy. Sharing with you the signal used in days past to summon the man, Wheiskaet sends you to Bloodshore in the hopes that his erstwhile companion will show.

Lorens, the former Company sharpshooter spoken so highly of by Wheiskaet, reveals himself in response to your whistling. Very much a lone wolf, he nevertheless agrees to join your cause out of curiosity and concern for his old friends. You get the impression that he has a somewhat complex relationship with Merlwyb as well, and he invites you to join him near Hidden Falls so that he might elaborate.

As you look out over the sea together, Lorens shares with you a tragic episode from his and Merlwyb's past: the tale of how she was forced to kill her own father, the famed pirate captain Bloefhis. In fighting to save his daughter and her companions from Leviathan's wrath, the captain and a good number of his crew were tempered by the primal. The nature of their condition did not become apparent until they vanished, only to reappear as the Serpent Reavers a while later, a band of pirates wholly devoted to the Lord of the Whorl. Merlwyb subsequently tracked her father to an isle where she found him, a broken shell of the man he once was, and defeated him in a duel to the death as Lorens stood witness.

The reckless and aggressive manner in which Merlwyb threw herself against her father's minions left an enduring impression on Lorens, who vowed to henceforth support her from a distance as he had in the chaos of that day. With a promise to assist you in a similar fashion when it comes time to confront the blasphemy, he takes his leave and returns to the shadows.

Wheiskaet is heartened by the news that Lorens will be joining you, believing him the trump card you and the Company of Heroes need to turn the tide of battle when next you face your formidable foe. Confident that you have taken great strides towards achieving success in your mission, you set out to return to Limsa and report the good news.

Back at Maelstrom Command, the secretariat is pleased to hear that Lorens─whose name she seems to vaguely recall─will be joining the fight against the blasphemy. Thanking you for your efforts, she encourages you to rest up until the beast is found. The hour of your final confrontation is nigh.

※The next role quest will be available from the Maelstrom secretariat upon reaching level 90 in any melee DPS class.
objectives: Speak with Wheiskaet in Costa del Sol.
Whistle at the forked road in Bloodshore.
Speak with the secretariat at Maelstrom Command.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I wish I had better news for you, but the blasphemy continues to elude us.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: (-Wheiskaet-)Can you hear me, Commander? This is Wheiskaet.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: (-Wheiskaet-)I have an idea how we might take down the blasphemy. Meet me in Costa del Sol as soon as you are able.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: Well, that sounds promising! I'll tell the Admiral you'll be away for a bit. Godsspeed, and stay safe out there.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Apologies for having you come all this way, Forename.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Ever since our encounter with the blasphemy, I've been wracking my brain to find a way of dealing with its debilitating attack. Sadly, I've come up empty-handed─and my companions fare no better.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: That's when I started thinking: if only our finest was still with us. He always had a knack for noticing what the rest of us missed.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: His eyes were so sharp, he could spot a foe's weakness with a single glance.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: It's thanks to him that we were able to slay both Leviathan and Titan...and live to tell the tale.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The rub is...well, he's a bit eccentric. And yes, I know you could say that about all the Company members.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: But unlike us, he prefers to work from the shadows. Truth be told, I've not seen him since the day we disbanded.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I doubt he'd help his old comrades, even if we asked. But an order from the Company's acting commander would be a different story.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: In our heyday, we had a way of reaching him. Whistle at the forked road, and sooner or later, he'd show himself.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Didn't matter when─winter or summer, in broad sunlight or the dead of night. He'd always be watching from afar. With any luck, he still is now...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: ...But I've rambled on enough. Go on, now. This may be our best─and only─hope.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, the blasphemy continues to elude us. Should there be any change, we will inform you posthaste.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Here I was, enjoyin' my retirement... <sigh> Why'd you have to go and bloody whistle...

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Call me Lorens. I'm the Company's resident sharpshooter...'least I was in my day. No need to tell me who you are. I've been watchin' you for quite some time.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Don't get the wrong idea. I'm just...curious how my former mates are farin'.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Not as curious as folks were about me, though. First Wheiskaet, then ol' Mistbeard himself. Ha! As if those codgers could ever catch me!

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: And now Eorzea's storied 'ero summons me forth. No need to say why─yer going to ask me to help you take down the blasphemy.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm not asking you. I'm ordering you.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Have you forgotten the duty of the strong?

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Bahaha! You drive a hard bargain. I like that. Who am I to refuse an order from the Company's actin' commander?

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: ...Heh. Never could refuse whenever someone trotted out those 'ackneyed words.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: So tell me, Actin' Commander, what specific duty would ye task me with? I trust ye do have a plan...

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: So ye need a way to neutralize the beast's most potent attack.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: I can tell ye like getting up close and personal with yer foes. So ye'll be needin' support from a distance. Who do ye suppose might be best suited to that role?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Merlwyb and her twin muskets can handle the job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You, of course.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: A reasonable answer...but wrong.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Damn right. My eyes are among the keenest in the realm, as ye've doubtless heard from Wheiskaet.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: In pure marksmanship, none in Limsa are the Admiral's equal.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Yet Merlwyb is ill-suited for a supportin' role. Not for lack of skill, o' course, but rather... Come to think of it, there's something ye should know. Follow me.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Remember the signal─whistle at the forked road. And let's just hope our man deigns to show.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Quite the view, wouldn't ye say? I often come here to admire the sea.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: If ye would, indulge me for a moment and I'll spin ye a yarn. Just try not to doze off.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Back in piracy's golden age, the League o' Lost Bastards ruled the Rhotano. I was one of them, as was Merlwyb. We were led by none other than her old man, Bloefhis Bloefhisyn, the most feared captain on the 'igh seas.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Feared by his enemies, that is. Stern and unforgivin' though he was, he took me under his wing and showed me the ropes.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Aye, he was like a father to me. To us all. Till that fateful day...

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Was in the year 1562 of the Sixth Astral Era. Lominsan merchantmen were strugglin' with nigh-constant raids by the Sahagin.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: 'Round this time Bloefhis had yielded the day-to-day leadership of the Bastards to Merlwyb, his pride and joy. She was still growin' into the role, though, and everyone knew the old captain was still callin' the shots.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Ol' Bloefhis had a noble streak, he did. Ordered us to defend the traders from the fishbacks. Merlwyb led the effort, and we fought day after day to keep the seas safe.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: The fightin' was fierce, but we always came out of it in one piece...until we didn't. Until after a skirmish, a Sahagin survivor, with his last breath, summoned forth the Lord o' the Whorl.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: The great beast toppled our masts and cracked the keel like an egg. We clambered aboard the merchantman as our own ship sank. Naught to do but wait for the end. But then comes Bloefhis and his bleedin' flotilla out of nowhere to pull us out o' the fire. And he did.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: But the League of Lost Bastards would never be the same again. For even though we'd escaped with our lives, we soon discovered that Captain Bloefhis, our iron-willed, unwaverin' leader, had fallen under Leviathan's thrall.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: 'Course, in those days, we didn't know much about drownin' or temperin'. Didn't know what to make of our captain as he grew more 'aggard by the day, his words devolvin' into crazed ramblin'. Then, one day, he vanishes...takin' off with 'alf of our men.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Not long after, a band of pirates callin' themselves the Serpent Reavers began takin' prizes in the Indigo Deep alongside the Sahagin. At their helm was none other than Captain Bloefhis, who'd cast his lot with the fishbacks.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Merlwyb knew what had to be done─and to her credit, she didn't shirk from the deed. She acted quickly, sneakin' off under cover o' night with a skeleton crew without so much as tellin' me. 'Course, that didn't stop me from stowin' myself in the cargo hold and joinin' her on the voyage.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: She was none too 'appy to see me at first─wanted to leave me out of it, she said. But seein' as I made myself known when she was strugglin' to fend off a horde o' Reavers and fishbacks, it wasn't hard to win her over. Her twin muskets fellin' one after the next─as my sharpshootin' kept her safe from afar─we cut a path to the center of the isle.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: It was there we found Bloefhis─or rather the miserable wretch he'd been reduced to. All bones, with skin shriveled and a tangled mat o' white hair, eyes bulging from his 'ead like a fish as he prayed to the Lord o' the Whorl...

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Merlwyb challenged him to a duel, and a dim memory must have flickered in his drowned mind, for he accepted. And so, with only me there to witness it, Merlwyb ended her father's life.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: The League o' Lost Bastards would've lived up to its name if it weren't for Merlwyb. She assumed full command and restored us to our former glory. Not long after, she triumphed in the Trident and was named Chief Admiral of Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: I often think back upon that day. Seein' her charge into battle, muskets blazin'... Might seem reckless to some, but that's how Captain Bloefhis taught her, and she knows no other way.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: That's why I made it my job to support her from the shadows─and it's a role in which I'll 'appily serve again. I owe that much to her old man.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: My only doubt was whether you, my friend, were worthy o' commandin' me. But watchin' ye from afar has answered that question.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Aye, tell Wheiskaet and the rest o' my no-good companions that Lorens stands with them.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Even during his days in the Company, Lorens would often go missing. He'd either lose his way─terrible sense of direction, that one─or he'd have to scarper following yet another monetary dispute. “Easy come, easy go,” he'd say, except his gil did more going than coming...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Did Lorens show himself?

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Haha! Now there's a surprise! I had some hope your words might reach him, but never did I imagine he would agree so readily...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Ah...just one thing, Forename. I'd appreciate it if you didn't mention Lorens's involvement to the Company─Landenel in particular. They'll find out soon enough regardless.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: At any rate, this gives us new hope in our battle against the blasphemy. All that remains is to set the snare and lure the beast into our clutches.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Our scouts are on the lookout for the creature as we speak. If the latest reports are to be believed, we are drawing ever closer.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: And with that, I'd best get back to it. Can I trust you to report these latest developments to the Maelstrom? Then till we meet again, Commander.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: The search for the blasphemy continues, though I understand you've been carrying out an entirely different investigation.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: A marksman by the name of Lorens, eh? The Admiral will be pleased.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: Of course, we won't have much call for his skills until the blasphemy is found. Rest well and prepare yourself as necessary in the meantime.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: “Lorens”... Why does that ring a bell?

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The Admiral should be pleased to hear that Lorens will be joining our fight.
